titleStmt.title: John W. Ray to James F. Robinson
CWG8025

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Indianapolis Ind
July 23, 1863
Gov Robinson
Frankfort Ky
Sir
I Enclose herewith letter from Gov O. P. Morton,

Having removed from Jeffersonville to this place, I have been requested by some of my acquaintance of the Louisville Bar to apply for appointment as Commissioner from the State of which you are the Executive.
Should you appoint me, be pleased to have the Commission sent here.
I will remit fees for Commission &c on being advised the amt.
